Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
    The main hook of our game. This class with both act as a manager for the display and central mediator for the game logic. Display management will consist of a loop that cycles round all entities in the game asking them to move and then drawing them in the appropriate place. With the help of an inner class it will also allow the player to control the main ship. As a mediator it will be informed when entities within our game detect events (e.g. alient killed, played died) and will take appropriate game actions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • updateLogic

        public void updateLogic()
        Notification from a game entity that the logic of the game should be run at the next opportunity (normally as a result of some game event)

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Remove an entity from the game. The entity removed will no longer move or be drawn.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity that should be removed

      • notifyDeath

        public void notifyDeath()
        Notification that the player has died.

      • notifyWin

        public void notifyWin()
        Notification that the player has won since all the aliens are dead.

      • notifyAlienKilled

        public void notifyAlienKilled()
        Notification that an alien has been killed

      • tryToFire

        public void tryToFire()
        Attempt to fire a shot from the player. Its called "try" since we must first check that the player can fire at this point, i.e. has he/she waited long enough between shots

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        The main game loop. This loop is running during all game play as is responsible for the following activities:

        - Working out the speed of the game loop to update moves - Moving the game entities - Drawing the screen contents (entities, text) - Updating game events - Checking Input

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
        The entry point into the game. We'll simply create an instance of class which will start the display and game loop.
        Parameters:
        argv - The arguments that are passed into our game
